body:
if you want to migrate your old shares you can use this class: https://gist.github.com/mtgap/20a7e9ecd9d002cb8742

the update was commented out here: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/files_sharing-ported/lib/public/share.php#l106

i need to have all the share backends registered with the share manager before the update starts. i can't think of how to do it right now, does anyone have a suggestion?

test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/478/
@schiesbn @deepdiver1975 can you help with testing? @mtgap the migration should be done automatically by an update script, right?

@mtgap  any clue why the unit tests are failing? 
@karlitschek only test or test and fix ;-)
@deepdiver1975 two excellent questions. ;-) unfortunately @mtgap should answer both but he is afk for 1 week.  :-)

> i need to have all the share backends registered with the share manager before the update starts. i can't think of how to do it right now, does anyone have a suggestion?

we need to make sure that everything gets upgraded automatically. since every app can implement a share back-end it is not possible to know if all share back-ends are registered. it could also happen that a app which implements a share back-end is temporary disabled and gets enabled later again.

the only solution i see is to do incremental upgrades: upgrade the back-ends which are there and store the information somewhere. check the migration status every time a back-end gets registered, if it is not yet upgraded, start the upgrade process for it.
one more remark: why do the share back-ends need to be registered for the migration at all? shouldn't it be sufficient to simply transfer the old table to the new one?

> shouldn't it be sufficient to simply transfer the old table to the new one?

good call - fully agree from a theoretical point of view

> one more remark: why do the share back-ends need to be registered for the migration at all? shouldn't it be sufficient to simply transfer the old table to the new one?

nope, because there are some differences involved with parent ids.

tests are still failing because of oracle.
and did anyone actually try it out yet?

actually wrong - tests are failing on all 4 databases. read the logs on jenkins

those are the files encryption tests. i never said that i ported that app. 

what were the other questions?

i find it rather strange that changes to sharing have an impact on the tests of encryption.â 
this is a clear indication that the apps are nor that separated as they should be.â 

can you please explain the reason for this?â 

regarding open questions i'd like to ask you to browse the conversion of the original pull request.â 

thanks a lot

one final note: please don't gey me wrong in bashing this stuff that bad.â 

sharing is the most important part of owncloud and any failure in this area is more than critical.â 

and i'd rather continue with the old code that kind of works than go with the new implementation even if the old code is a mess.

and once more migration us the most important topic here. as long as this is missing or has uncertainties it us pointless having a look at the rest.

> i find it rather strange that changes to sharing have an impact on the tests of encryption.â 
> this is a clear indication that the apps are nor that separated as they should be.â 

nothing is separated as it should be... i started working on porting encryption, but it is simply incoherent what's going on in there. @schiesbn you're going to have work on this with me soon. please let me know when you're available.

> and once more migration us the most important topic here. as long as this is missing or has uncertainties it us pointless having a look at the rest.

it's now included.

test **failed**.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/638/

@mtgap beside friday i'm the whole week online just ping me.

some information: the encryption app needs to be able to get a list of all users with access to a given file/folder by the sharing app. this is needed to encrypt the file to the right group of people. the current sharing api provides this functionality here: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/lib/public/share.php#l136. 
if the tests fails than i assume that you didn't ported this part to the new share api yet, right? ideally the function signature stays the same so that we don't have to change anything at the encryption app. if you really have to change the function signature we can also adapt the encryption app, there are only two places where we call the function:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/apps/files_encryption/lib/util.php#l1143
https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/apps/files_encryption/lib/util.php#l1608

but honestly i don't see a reason why we have to change the function signature. it should be possible to provide the same function for the new sharing api.

you guys added those methods without my explicit approval. those aren't methods that should be included in the share api because it's supposed to be generic and not files related.

the tests fail because you didn't write proper unit tests with mocks.

from my point of view it looks like recoverfile should be calling getsharingusersarray. i'll rewrite the getuserssharingfile method inside files_encryption.

> you guys added those methods without my explicit approval. 

afaik sam was in contact with your regarding this function. but i don't care let's look forward.

> those aren't methods that should be included in the share api because it's supposed to be generic and not files related.

that's a valid argument. you could easily make it generic by adding a parameter, e.g. a array with a list of share types for which kind of shares the function should search for. or put it in the share back-end so that every back-end can provide a suitable implementation. generally i think it would be good to have not only a function which starts with a user and finds all "file-type" shared to the user but also the other away around, start at a "share item" and find all users with access to it.

> the tests fail because you didn't write proper unit tests with mocks.

this has also an advantage. this way we saw that it will fail in the real world. with a mock everything would look fine and in the real world it would crash because the real share api doesn't provide the same functionality as the mock.

> from my point of view it looks like recoverfile should be calling getsharingusersarray.

this was also my thought when i looked at the code. but we have to be careful and check that it is really the same.

>  i'll rewrite the getuserssharingfile method inside files_encryption.

i'm also fine with it. but as said above a generic function which search this way around might be useful for the general share api. if you have any problems/questions regarding the encryption app feel free to get in contact with me.

> this has also an advantage. this way we saw that it will fail in the real world. with a mock everything would look fine and in the real world it would crash because the real share api doesn't provide the same functionality as the mock.

it should be done with integration or acceptance tests.

some additional notes: not sure if this is directly related to your changes. as said, sharing a folder works, but i cant open the drop-down with the permissions in the share dialog. further after page reload the indicator that the folder is shared is gone, i remember that this was fixed some time ago so maybe a simple rebase will already solve the issue.

> i just debugged it a bit: the post request sends permission 31, but arevalidpermissions() in filesharebackend.php calculates 27 (which misses iscreatable because it is not a directory). sharing a folder works, because there i also have the iscreatable permission.

yes, this time the checks are a little smarter.

> . further after page reload the indicator that the folder is shared is gone

i already stated at the top that this wasn't implemented.
the update is fixed now.
